attributes.action: Prevent Airlines/Travel agents charging extortionate re-booking fee & fare diff.
attributes.additional_details:
Travel agents and Airline companies take unfair advantage especially during crisis times and charge extortionate amount as fare difference and booking fees.
Due to COVID-19 I couldn't travel as planned and I was given only one option to re-book with new dates by paying fare difference. My original tkt cost £1,219 but when I checked new dates the price were £1,578 which means I shouldn't be paying more than £400 still I've been quoted £1,039 to pay as fare difference.
THIS EXTORTION NEEDS TO STOP
attributes.background: A law preventing Airline companies and Travel agents charging extortionate re-booking fees and fare difference at least during crisis times such as COVID-19 or any global crisis times. There should be a regulated flat re-booking fee for all and a very strong regulation for charging fare difference.

rejection.details:
Arrangements for changing or rebooking travel are a matter for individual airlines and travel agents, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to create a fund to reimburse money lost due to covid-19 travel cancellations, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304912

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
